text.headline: Heart Failure Prediction Study
text.text: Cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) are the leading cause of death globally, accounting for 31% of all deaths worldwide, which is estimated to be 17.9 million deaths annually

text.headline: Protocol Development
text.text:
1. Develop a study protocol outlining the research question, objectives, study design, and inclusion/exclusion criteria.
2. Conduct a literature review to identify existing research and knowledge gaps in the field.
3. Finalize the study protocol and obtain ethical clearance from the appropriate review board.

text.headline: Participant Recruitment and Screening
text.text:
1. Identify potential study participants and initiate recruitment activities.
2. Screen participants based on inclusion/exclusion criteria and obtain informed consent.

text.headline: Data Collection
text.text:
1. Collect data from study participants through various methods such as interviews, surveys, and medical tests.
2. Ensure data quality and accuracy by implementing appropriate data management procedures.
